content: I have just edited the statement, including fixing a few typos and clarifying that a word which consists of non-alphabetic characters only is not modified.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: very clear and straightforward ! Nice job.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Sounds fun and is really straightforward

I like it. Straightforward and clear, Upvoted.

Just a couple of comments after trying it out.

For fastest and shortest mode it would be nice to write upfront what is meant by "punctuation". 

Punctuation can be many things like ",.;:[](){}-_" and more.

e.g. you can specify: ".,?!" so there is no need to guess or look through the tests to find the answer. (which you can't right now because e.g. "!" is hidden in validator)

I also think your test 4 and 5, and validators should match. e.g. in 4 you test "," but the validator test "!" at the end of the string, which is completely different. This means that you can have 100% correct in test cases, but will fail after submitting.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Sounds a fair challenge both for rapidity and size of code ! had some fun solving it !

The current version of the "énoncé" is not very clear.
Meanwhile, tests are ok for "reverse" mode of CoC.
Finally, in your proposed solution you test for alpha chars in the sentence, ensuring that any digit or ponctuation signs will have no effect. But none of your tests show this, and the énoncé does not state anything also.
Maybe your puzzle could be better specified if you clearly choose the mode you want to be used : faster ou reverse ?
